intro: Ambrosina unilocularis, commonly known as the single-chamber ambrosia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the early spring. Its unique structure includes a single chamber within its fruit, which is an adaptation for seed dispersal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Ambrosina unilocularis is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
